history.content:
Nick's policy in recent semesters has been to only expand the class if the department gives more budget. The reasoning is that expanding without extra budget sends a message to the university that we can survive with budget cuts, which is definitely not true, as the enrollment nightmares have shown in the last few semesters. Given how the entire department is buckling under budget cuts, I can't really see a scenario where CS 161 is at the front of the line for getting extra budget. I'd imagine the money would go to required lower-divs with long waitlists like EE 16B before it would reach an optional upper-div like CS 161.

That said, my guess is that the huge waitlist might be coming from the fact that CS 161 is currently not listed for Spring 2022. Our current goal is to find some way to offer the class in spring, and hopefully that will cause the fall waitlist to drastically decrease as many people decide to wait until spring to take the class. I can't promise anything though - we're still in the early stages of working this all out. We will keep you posted as we learn more.

children.subject: I'd like to offer it if possible, but it will depend on finding enough experienced staff to run it.
@Peyrin, is there any plan of offering 161 next Summer - summer 2022, or is it too early to discuss about that? Thanks.
We haven't heard anything on the course staff side, but I assume it will follow the same reordering process as the other CS upper-divs.
Will the 161 wait list be reorganized to prioritized declared CS/EECS students?

history.content: Is there a chance of CS161 expanding? Based on berkeley time enrollment I decided to phase 2 it, but the class is full and the waitlist has about 100 people on it and there's no reserved seats. Any insight on this would be really helpful! sadly stressed that the way enrolled in classes was a bad decision :(
history.subject: CS161 Expanding?
